title: Tour de France 2021 Standings after Stage 17
content:
General Classification / Yellow Jersey 

The General Classification stayed the same today with the yellow jersey contenders rolling in together, allowing the breakaway to fight it out for a stage win.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Jonas Vingegaard +5:39
3. Richard Carapaz +5:43
4. Rigoberto Uran +7:17
5. Ben O'Connor +7:34
6. Wilco Kelderman +8:06
7. Enric Mas +9:48
8. Enric Mas +10:04
9. Guillaume Martin +11:51
10. Pello Bilbao +12:53

Tour de France 2021 Guide

Points Classification / Green Jersey

Mark Cavendish's closest rival Matthews gained a further 35 points today after finishing third overall on the stage. He's edging closer to the Manxman day by day, and the Green Jersey competition looks to be hotting up as we get closer to Paris.

1. Mark Cavendish - 279 points
2. Michael Matthews - 242 points
3. Sonny Colbrelli - 195 points
4. Jasper Philipsen - 174 points
5. Julian Alaphilippe - 135 points

The Tour de France jerseys – the race so far

King of the Mountains Classification / Polka-Dot Jersey

With none of the main contenders for the polka dots in the breakaway today, the top 5 of this classification remains the same. 

1. Wout Poels - 74 points
2. Michael Woods - 66 points
3. Nairo Quintana - 64 points
4. Wout van Aert - 64 points
5. Bauke Mollema - 41 points

Young Rider's Classification / White Jersey

David Gaudu jumps ahead of Aurélien Paret-Peintre in this classification after today's stage. The FDJ rider spent the day in the breakaway and finished 14 minutes ahead of the peloton.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Jonas Vingegaard +5:32
3. David Gaudu +14:13
4.Aurélien Paret-Peintre +22:10
5. Sergio Higuita +1:00:19

 

 Team Classification

1. Bahrain Victorious
2. EF Education-Nippo +35:42
3. AG2R Citroen +50:26
4. Trek Segafredo +51:16
5. Team Jumbo Visma +55:45
